Class HexBoardView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
UI.view.HexBoardView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class HexBoardView extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
JavaFX view component that renders an interactive Hex board.

This class is responsible for:

  • Drawing a boardSize x boardSize grid of hexagonal cells
  • Updating cell fills based on the current BoardAdapter state
  • Forwarding mouse clicks on cells to a GameController
  • Displaying turn and win information through an attached Label
  • Drawing colored border lines indicating the goal edges for each player

Cells are stored as Polygon nodes in a 2D array (hexCells) so they can be updated efficiently without redrawing the whole board.

  • Field Details

    • boardSize

      private final int boardSize
      Logical board dimension (number of rows/columns).

    • hexSize

      private final double hexSize
      Size parameter controlling the rendered hexagon width. Internally, the hexagon radius is computed as hexSize / 2.

    • hexCells

      private final javafx.scene.shape.Polygon[][] hexCells
      JavaFX polygons representing the visual hexagonal cells. Indexed as hexCells[row][col].

    • controller

      private GameController controller
      Controller that receives user interaction events (cell clicks). May be null if not wired.

    • turnLabel

      private javafx.scene.control.Label turnLabel
      Optional UI label used to show turn/win status. May be null if not set.

  • Constructor Details

    • HexBoardView

      public HexBoardView(int boardSize, double hexSize)
      Creates a Hex board view and immediately draws an empty board.
      Parameters:
      boardSize - the board dimension (rows and columns)
      hexSize - the rendered size of each hex cell (used to derive radius and spacing)

  • Method Details

    • setController

      public void setController(GameController controller)
      Sets the controller that will handle user interactions on the board.

      When a user clicks a cell, GameController.handleCellClick(int, int) will be called with the clicked (row, col).

      Parameters:
      controller - the controller to notify on cell clicks

    • setTurnLabel

      public void setTurnLabel(javafx.scene.control.Label turnLabel)
      Sets the label used to display current turn and winner messages.
      Parameters:
      turnLabel - the label to update; may be null to disable text updates

    • update

      public void update(BoardAdapter adapter)
      Updates the board cell colors from the given adapter.

      This does not recreate nodes; it only updates fills of the existing polygons for performance.

      Parameters:
      adapter - the board adapter providing the current cell colors

    • updateTurnDisplay

      public void updateTurnDisplay(Player currentPlayer)
      Updates the attached label to show which player is currently to move.

      If no label is attached via setTurnLabel(Label), this method is a no-op.

      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - the player whose turn it is

    • updateWinDisplay

      public void updateWinDisplay(Player winner)
      Updates the attached label to show the winning player.

      If no label is attached via setTurnLabel(Label), this method is a no-op.

      Parameters:
      winner - the player who won the game

    • drawEmptyBoard

      private void drawEmptyBoard()
      Draws a fresh empty board: clears children, creates hexagon polygons, installs click handlers, and draws border lines.

    • createHexagon

      private javafx.scene.shape.Polygon createHexagon(double centerX, double centerY, double radius)
      Creates a single flat-topped hexagon polygon centered at (centerX, centerY).

      The vertices are generated in 60-degree steps with a -30 degree offset, producing a flat-topped hex orientation.

      Parameters:
      centerX - the x-coordinate of the hexagon center
      centerY - the y-coordinate of the hexagon center
      radius - the distance from center to each vertex
      Returns:
      a configured Polygon representing one hex cell

    • paintForColor

      private javafx.scene.paint.Paint paintForColor(Color color)
      Maps game Color values to JavaFX Paint objects for rendering.
      Parameters:
      color - the game color enum value
      Returns:
      the JavaFX paint used to fill the cell

    • drawBoardBorders

      private void drawBoardBorders(double padding, double radius, double width, double height)
      Draws the outer boundary lines of the board to visually indicate the goal edges.

      In Hex, each player aims to connect opposing sides: this method draws two red borders and two black borders to represent those sides.

      Parameters:
      padding - the padding offset applied to all board coordinates
      radius - the hex radius (center to vertex)
      width - the nominal hex width (equals hexSize)
      height - the nominal hex height component (derived from radius)
